dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news from Alibaba this week, huh? Their Hong Kong listing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big news from Alibaba this week, huh? Their Hong Kong listing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, huge! Like, the biggest IPO of the year so far. Definitely getting some buzz.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, huge! Like, the biggest I P O of the year so far. Definitely getting some buzz.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the worlds biggest IPO so far this year, Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba is set to raise up to $12.9 billion in a landmark public listing in Hong Kong...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, we're talking about them potentially raising up to almost thirteen billion dollars. That's, uh, that's a lot of cash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, we're talking about them potentially raising up to almost thirteen billion dollars. That's, uh, that's a lot of cash.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba is set to raise up to $12.9 billion in a landmark public listing in Hong Kong...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It is! And, you know, it's actually a *secondary* listing for them. They're already on the New York Stock Exchange.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is! And, you know, it's actually a secondary listing for them. They're already on the New York Stock Exchange.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The debut on the Hong Kong stock exchange is a secondary listing for Alibaba, which initially went public on the New York Stock Exchange in 2014...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, from 2014. That was, like, the biggest IPO *ever* back then, wasn't it? Twenty-five billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, from twenty fourteen. That was, like, the biggest I P O ever back then, wasn't it? Twenty-five billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...initially went public on the New York Stock Exchange in 2014, raising $25 billion in the worlds biggest IPO in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. So, uh, this one's a bit smaller, but still absolutely massive, especially for Hong Kong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. So, uh, this one's a bit smaller, but still absolutely massive, especially for Hong Kong.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the Hong Kong angle is super interesting. With all the unrest there, this is a real boost for their financial markets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the Hong Kong angle is super interesting. With all the unrest there, this is a real boost for their financial markets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas listing will help boost Hong Kongs financial markets, given that the city recently slid into recession for the first time in over a decade, following more than five months of anti-government protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. I mean, they've been in recession, so this kind of investment... it's a really big deal for the city.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. I mean, they've been in recession, so this kind of investment... it's a really big deal for the city.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the city recently slid into recession for the first time in over a decade, following more than five months of anti-government protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the shares were priced at a slight discount, but still, demand was just skyrocketing, right? They closed the books early.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the shares were priced at a slight discount, but still, demand was just skyrocketing, right? They closed the books early.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba said that it would price shares at $HK176 ($22.50) each, a discount of 2.9% to its New York Stock Exchange closing price... the skyrocketing demand for shares caused Alibaba to close its books earlier than expected, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, super early. Which just shows you the appetite there is for Alibaba stock.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, super early. Which just shows you the appetite there is for Alibaba stock.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild. This could actually double their cash pile compared to, like, Tencent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild. This could actually double their cash pile compared to, like, Tencent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Scheduled for November 26, the listing could swell Alibabas cash pile to around $44 billion, which would be more than any other internet company and double that of rival e-commerce giant Tencent, according to Bloomberg.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is crazy for an internet company! They'll have around 44 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is crazy for an internet company! They'll have around forty four billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Scheduled for November 26, the listing could swell Alibabas cash pile to around $44 billion...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So it just totally dwarfs Uber's IPO earlier this year, or even AB InBev's.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it just totally dwarfs Uber's I P O earlier this year, or even A B InBev's.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would also be the worlds biggest IPO so far in 2019: Alibabas Hong Kong listing exceeds Ubers $8.1 billion public debut in New York and AB InBevs $5 billion IPO of its Asia business in Hong Kong earlier this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Though, um, Aramco is coming later, which could actually break Alibaba's *original* record, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Though, um, Aramco is coming later, which could actually break Alibaba's original record, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas listing will likely be eclipsed by Saudi Arabias state oil giant Saudi Aramco, going public on the Riyadh stock exchange in December, with its IPO set to raise up to $25.6 billionthat could break Alibabas existing record for the worlds largest IPO in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, that's another story for another day. But this also plays into the whole US-China trade thing, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, that's another story for another day. But this also plays into the whole U S China trade thing, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And with the ongoing U.S.-China trade war leading the Chinese government to call for companies to publicly list closer to home, Alibabas listing helps cement the Hong Kong Stock Exchange as one of this years largest venues for IPOs...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. China's been pushing companies to list closer to home, so this really cements Hong Kong as a major IPO hub.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. China's been pushing companies to list closer to home, so this really cements Hong Kong as a major I P O hub.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...with the ongoing U.S.-China trade war leading the Chinese government to call for companies to publicly list closer to home, Alibabas listing helps cement the Hong Kong Stock Exchange as one of this years largest venues for IPOs...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Makes sense. And speaking of big numbers, Alibaba just smashed Singles Day records too, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes sense. And speaking of big numbers, Alibaba just smashed Singles Day records too, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its eleventh edition of Singles Day, the biggest shopping event in the world, Alibaba set a new sales record of $38.4 billion in gross merchandise volume during the 24-hour shopping bonanza.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, my gosh, yeah! Thirty-eight point four billion in one day. Like, way more than Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Amazon Prime Day combined.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, my gosh, yeah! Thirty-eight point four billion in one day. Like, way more than Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Amazon Prime Day combined.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its eleventh edition of Singles Day... Alibaba set a new sales record of $38.4 billion in gross merchandise volume during the 24-hour shopping bonanza. To compare, Singles Day far outpaces other big e-commerce days in the U.S., with Alibabas haul more than double the amount sold on last years Black Friday, Cyber Monday and Amazon Prime Day combined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. What a year for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. What a year for them.
